title: Casa de la Corregidora
description: This historic building is a symbol of Mexico's independence. The Casa de la Corregidora was where key events of the independence movement were planned.

title: Historic Center of Querétaro
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the historic center features Baroque and Neoclassical architecture, with civil and religious monuments reflecting its rich history.

title: Santa Rosa de Viterbo Church
description: A stunning example of Querétaro Baroque style, with intricate Solomonic columns and a richly decorated interior. Its hand-carved wooden pulpit and organ are highlights.

title: Plaza de Armas
description: The heart of the city, surrounded by landmarks like the Government Palace and Casa de los Corregidores. A perfect spot for leisurely walks.

title: Querétaro Aqueduct
description: This 18th-century marvel, with 74 arches, was built to transport water from a spring to the city. Today, it’s one of Querétaro’s most iconic landmarks.

title: Querétaro Industrial Park
description: Located south of the city, this premier industrial hub hosts top-tier infrastructure for automotive, aerospace, and other industries.

title: El Marqués Industrial Park
description: A key manufacturing zone, especially for tech and export sectors, with direct access to federal highways and the international airport.

title: Querétaro 2000
description: A modern business district near Querétaro Intercontinental Airport, ideal for investors expanding logistics and commercial operations.
